acts.act: Protection of children from sexual offence act 2012

business_details.Business: Accused Sri Jemson Hanse is produced from the jail hazot and he is again remanded till next date. Copy is furnished to him. Having very carefully gone through the submission duly advanced by the learned lawyers of the both sides as well as case diary, I find there is ground for presuming that the accused person committed the offence under section 6 of the POCSO Act and accordingly charge is framed. The particular of the offence charged is duly read over and explained to the accused person to which he pleaded not guilty and claimed to tried. Issue summons to the PWs.         Seen the petition being petition No. 2715/2019 filed by one Sri Joysing Hanse praying for allowing the accused Sri Jemson Hanse to go on bail on the ground stated in the petition supported by an affidavit. Heard learned lawyers of the both sides. Considering detention period and submission of charge sheet, the bail prayer is allowed. Accordingly the accused Sri Jemson Hanse is allowed to go on bail of Rs. 30,000/- with a local surety of like amount.          Fixing 03.01.2020 for evidence.
Accused absent with step.PW Mrs Rupmilan Killingpi is examined and discharged. Issue summon to rest PWs

CR is received on transfer from the Sesions Judge, K/A for disposal.        accd Jemson Hanse is present.       seen ptn no 229/20 wherein the petitioner the accd himself has prayed for adjournment of date as the engaged counsel is out of station,      one PW is present but could not be examined as the engaged defence counsel is absent.        issue summons to other PWS.
accd Jemson Hanse absent.      PWws absent, summons issued to PW horen Killing returned properly served, issue fresh summons to him.       also issue summons to other PWS.
Court proceeding paralyzed due to COVID-19 lock down.Accused namely Jemson Hanse is absent.PWs absent. Issue fresh summons to PW Horen Killing.
